description: When the user feels explosive, irritated, or resentful — needing self-restraint, control, and divine calm.

primary.text_en: ...those who restrain anger and who pardon the people — and Allah loves the doers of good.
primary.explanation: Self-restraint in anger is an act of divine goodness.

primary.text_en: ...and when they are angry, they forgive.
primary.explanation: True strength is in calm forgiveness.

primary.text_en: ...and when the ignorant address them harshly, they say [words of] peace.
primary.explanation: Rise above insults — respond with peace.

primary.text_en: Take what is given freely, enjoin what is good, and turn away from the ignorant.
primary.text_ar: خُذِ ٱلۡعَفۡوَ وَأۡمُرْ بِٱلۡعُرْفِ وَأَعۡرِضْ عَنِ ٱلۡجَـٰهِلِينَ

primary.text_en: ...and tell My servants to say that which is best. Indeed, Satan sows discord among them...
primary.text_ar: وَقُل لِّعِبَادِى يَقُولُوا۟ ٱلَّتِى هِىَ أَحۡسَنُ...
primary.explanation: Control your words — anger opens the door to Shaytan.

primary.text_en: The strong man is not the one who can overpower others, but the one who controls himself when angry.
A man said to the Prophet ﷺ: 'Advise me.' He said: 'Do not get angry' — repeated three times.
primary.explanation: Anger is the root — control it, and everything else follows.

primary.text_en: When one of you becomes angry, let him remain silent.
If one of you is angry while standing, sit down. If anger leaves, good. If not, lie down.
primary.explanation: Change your posture to cool your anger.

primary.text_en: Anger is a burning coal. Don't act when your heart is burning.
primary.explanation: Wait till calm returns before acting.

duas.text_en: O Allah, remove anger from my heart and replace it with patience.
duas.text_ar: اللَّهُمَّ أَذْهِبْ غَيْظَ قَلْبِي وَاخْلُفْنِي حِلْمًا
duas.explanation: A simple but heartfelt plea for calm.

duas.text_en: I seek refuge in Allah from the accursed devil.

reflection: Anger is fire. It burns logic, relationships, and the heart itself. But Allah gave you water — wudu, patience, silence, and dhikr — to extinguish it. Take a breath. Your silence now may save years of regret later.
